item.title: Canadian dollar strengthens as oil rises, greenback slides

div.a: Canadian dollar strengthens as oil rises, greenback slides

The Globe and Mail - Jan 5, 2017
The Canadian dollar strengthened to a three-week high against its U.S. counterpart on Thursday as oil prices rose and the greenback lost ground against a basket of major currencies.

item.title: TSX gains 91 points; Canadian dollar up

div.a: TSX gains 91 points; Canadian dollar up
div.br:
Times Colonist - Jan 3, 2017
The Canadian dollar was at 74.54 cents US, up 0.06 of a U.S. cent from Friday's close. The January crude contract rose 44 cents to US$54.16 per barrel and February natural gas was down 31.5 cents at US$3.41 per mmBTU. TSX, New York make gains on first trading day of 2017 - CBC.ca

item.title: USD/CAD – Canadian Dollar Steady Ahead of Canadian, US Job Numbers

div.a: USD/CAD – Canadian Dollar Steady Ahead of Canadian, US Job Numbers
div.br:
MarketPulse (blog) - Jan 6, 2017
The Canadian dollar is showing limited movement on Friday. Currently, USD/CAD is trading at 1.3240. It's a busy day on the release front, with a host of employment indicators on the schedule.

item.title: USD/CAD – Canadian Dollar Jumps as OPEC Production Cuts Kick In

The Canadian dollar has posted strong gains in the Wednesday session. Early in the North American session, USD/CAD is trading slightly above the 1.33 line.
